page.title: 12Media in Stratton
page.content: Every house in Stratton has television and radio. There is a delivery of morning and evening papers. These are concerned with world events rather than local news. Children especially if isolated turn to television and some in the village seem to spend up to six hours a night viewing. 2CR local radio from Bournemouth can be heard with difficulty. Several Citizens Band devotees are known - these are attempts to break down the remoteness of world news. Every house also gets a copy of the Chalkstream, the magazine covering the four parishes. Local events are thus advertised. Use of videos and computers is now widespread, though their communication advantages have not been realised yet. There are telephones in most houses, and a public call box by the pub.
